title: Add tier markers to TestCatalogFetch test methods
description: TestCatalogFetch test methods missing @pytest.mark.tier() markers. All test methods (lines 194-393) should have tier markers for CI job separation. Location: tests/unit/test_cli.py:194-393

description: Tests lack @pytest.mark.tier markers for CI job separation. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: Implement catalog.versions(name, limit=10) -> list[ObjectVersion]
description: Add catalog.versions() method to list available versions of a dataset. Part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking - Library API.

title: TestCatalogFetch class missing TRA marker
description: TestCatalogFetch class (tests/unit/test_cli.py:191) missing @pytest.mark.tra() anchor. Should have TRA marker like @pytest.mark.tra('UseCase.Fetch') or similar. All test classes should have TRA markers for test maintainability.

title: Implement catalog.fetch(name, as_of=datetime) - fetch version at point in time
description: Implement catalog.fetch(name, as_of=datetime) to fetch a version at a specific point in time. This is part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking. The method should resolve the closest version at or before the specified datetime using the version resolution logic.

title: FETCH-001: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tra anchors
description: Tests use @pytest.mark.core but no TRA namespace anchors. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: FETCH-004: FakeStorage exists only as local test class, not reusable fixture
description: FakeStorage exists only as local test class in test_ports.py, not as reusable fixture/adapter for versioned fetch tests. Location: tests/unit/test_ports.py:72-100

title: TestCatalogFetch test methods missing tier markers
description: TestCatalogFetch test methods (tests/unit/test_cli.py:194-393) missing @pytest.mark.tier() markers. All test methods should have tier markers for CI job separation. Methods: test_fetch_returns_cached_path, test_fetch_dataset_not_found_exits_with_error, test_fetch_with_catalog_flag, test_fetch_with_progress_does_not_crash, test_fetch_all_downloads_all_datasets, test_fetch_all_with_catalog_flag.

title: FETCH-002: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tier markers
description: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tier markers for CI job separation. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: Missing CLI integration tests for --as-of flag
description: CLI fetch --as-of flag is implemented (src/datacachalog/cli/main.py:147-152) but has no integration tests in test_cli.py. Core functionality is tested (TestFetchAsOf in test_catalog.py), but CLI integration tests are missing. Should test: --as-of flag parsing, error handling, version resolution via CLI.

title: Version-aware cache key strategy with date-based file paths
description: Currently cache keys use {name}@{version_id} format, but file paths should be date-based (e.g., 2024-12-14T093000.parquet) as specified in roadmap. The actual cached file paths should include the version date/timestamp, not just the cache key. Location: src/datacachalog/core/services.py:_fetch_version()

title: CLI commands for S3 version tracking
description: Implement CLI commands to interact with S3 object versions, allowing users to list versions and fetch historical versions by date. Part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking.

title: Implement catalog versions command
description: Add CLI command: catalog versions <dataset> to list available versions with dates and sizes. Include --limit=N flag to control number shown. Use human-friendly output with date as primary identifier (version_id hidden).

title: Refactor versions output to prioritize date/timestamp
description: Update the versions command output formatting to make date/timestamp the primary identifier. Currently shows: timestamp | version_id | size | flags. Should prioritize date prominently and improve formatting (e.g., better date display, relative dates).

title: Hide version_id from default versions output
description: Remove version_id from the default output of catalog versions command. Consider adding --verbose flag to show version_id when needed. Version_id should be hidden by default as per requirement: 'Human-friendly output: date as primary identifier, version_id hidden'.

title: Add CLI tests for versions command output format
description: Add tests in tests/unit/test_cli.py for the catalog versions command to verify: 1) output format prioritizes date, 2) version_id is hidden by default, 3) --limit flag works correctly, 4) proper formatting of dates, sizes, and flags. Follow existing CLI test patterns.

title: Add @pytest.mark.tra() anchor to TestVersions class
description: TestVersions class in tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1371 is missing @pytest.mark.tra() anchor. Should follow TRA namespace format (e.g., UseCase.Versions or Domain.Versions). Found during hex-parallel architecture analysis.

title: Add CLI tests for catalog versions command
description: CLI versions command has no tests. Should add TestCatalogVersions class in tests/unit/test_cli.py following existing CLI test patterns. Test: command execution, --limit flag, error handling, output format. Found during hex-parallel architecture analysis.

title: Add @pytest.mark.tier() markers to TestVersions tests
description: All TestVersions test methods in tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1374-1499 are missing @pytest.mark.tier() markers. Tests use moto (mock AWS) which suggests tier 1-2. Should add appropriate tier markers for CI job separation. Found during hex-parallel architecture analysis.

title: Add --as-of flag to catalog fetch command
description: Extend catalog fetch <dataset> command with --as-of=DATE flag to fetch version from a specific date. Date format: YYYY-MM-DD (e.g., 2024-12-10). Should resolve to closest version at or before that time.

title: FETCH-004: FakeStorage exists only as local test class, not reusable fixture
description: FakeStorage exists only as local test class in test_ports.py, not as reusable fixture/adapter for versioned fetch tests. Location: tests/unit/test_ports.py:72-100

title: Version resolution: as_of=datetime finds closest version at or before that time
description: Implement find_version_at() function that finds the version with last_modified closest to and <= as_of datetime. This is the core time-travel resolution logic. Location: src/datacachalog/core/models.py:220-245

title: catalog.versions(name, limit=10) -> list[ObjectVersion]
